item.title: Formally Verified Post-Quantum Cryptography
item.description: The US National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) just released the first three standards for Post-Quantum KEMs (ML-KEM) and Signatures (ML-DSA, SLH-DSA).

item.title: High Assurance IoT PQC
item.description: Together with our sister-company CryptoEng, we extend our libcrux cryptographic library with support for resource constrained IoT devices. Read their announcement here.

item.title: Conference Talks
item.description: Cryspen attended a number of conference in April and March. Here is a list of all slides and videos. We will update links when more resources become available.

item.title: Post-Quantum OpenMLS
item.description: OpenMLS now offers security against harvest-now-decrypt-later (HNDL) quantum adversaries. In #1546 we merged support for the X-Wing KEM draft, which is an early draft for securely combining elliptic-curve-based Diffie-Hellman with ML-KEM.

item.title: Post-Quantum Group Messaging
item.description: With multiple post-quantum cryptographic algorithms (ML-KEM, ML-DSA) nearing standardization, enterprises, research groups, and standards bodies have started investigating what post-quantum secure protocols should look like and what properties they should satisfy.
